content.text: State what is meant by a _field of force_
Gravitational fields and electric fields are two examples of fields of force
State one similarity and one difference between these two fields of force
similarity:
difference:
Two protons are isolated in space. Their centres are separated by a distance \(R\)
Each proton may be considered to be a point mass with point charge
Determine the magnitude of the ratio
force between protons due to electric field
force between protons due to gravitational field
State what is meant by a _mole_
Two containers A and B are joined by a tube of negligible volume, as illustrated in Fig. 2.1
The containers are filled with an ideal gas at a pressure of \(2.3 \times 10^{5} \text{Pa}\)
The gas in container A has volume \(3.1 \times 10^{3} \text{cm}^{3}\) and is at a temperature of \(17^{\circ} \text{C}\)
The gas in container B has volume \(4.6 \times 10^{3} \text{cm}^{3}\) and is at a temperature of \(30^{\circ} \text{C}\)
Calculate the total amount of gas, in mol, in the containers
amount = .........mol

the capacitance of the capacitor,

energy = .........mJ

Initially, the capacitors are uncharged
A potential difference of \(12\mathrm{V}\) is applied between points A and B
Determine the magnitude of the charge on one plate of capacitor X
charge = .........$\mu \mathrm{C}$

content.text: The magnet is now brought to rest and the voltmeter is replaced by a variable frequency alternating current supply that produces a constant r.m.s. current in the coil
The frequency of the supply is gradually increased from \(0.7f_0\) to \(1.3f_0\), where \(f_0\) is the frequency calculated in **(b)**

The magnet is displaced vertically and then released

the frequency,

wavelength = .........m

Explain briefly the main principles of the use of magnetic resonance to obtain diagnostic information about internal body structures
State and explain two reasons why this change has occurred
The radio link between a geostationary satellite and Earth may be attenuated by as much as 190 dB
Suggest why, as a result of this attenuation, the uplink and downlink frequencies must be different
The use of ionospheric reflection of radio waves for long-distance communication has, to a great extent, been replaced by satellite communication
Calculate the minimum effective signal power in the optic fibre
The fibre has an attenuation per unit length of \(1.9 \text{dB} \text{km}^{-1}\)
Calculate the maximum uninterrupted length of fibre for an input signal of power \(3.5 \text{mW}\)
length = .........km
The signal-to-noise ratio in an optic fibre must not fall below \(24 \text{dB}\). The average noise power in the fibre is \(5.6 \times 10^{-19} \text{W}\)
Suggest why infra-red radiation, rather than ultraviolet radiation, is used for long-distance communication using optic fibres
